meanings.definition: Shaky or unsteady in movement or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The doddery old man struggled to walk down the uneven path.
meanings.sent2: The toddler's doddery steps made his parents nervous.
meanings.sent3: The doddery cat tried to chase after the fast-moving toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The doddery bridge creaked under the weight of the heavy truck.
meanings.sent5: The doddery table wobbled whenever someone placed a glass on it.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of old age or senility.
meanings.sent1: The doddery dog slept most of the day in his cozy bed.
meanings.sent2: The doddery professor often forgot where he left his glasses.
meanings.sent3: The doddery clock ticked slowly, as if it had all the time in the world.
meanings.sent4: The doddery tree's branches sagged under the weight of the snow.
meanings.sent5: The doddery car sputtered and coughed before finally starting up.
